title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, orange and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite upper left margin in brackets "supposed to be 1/12"; in graphite at left center: "warp" [arrow]; "satin" and "rep" [with indicators on design]; in graphite right center, vertical line and "repeat"; In graphite upper right corner: 11

Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 26; in graphite right center 3 3/8 OK
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of small white circles with white centers, orange and pink quatrafoils and diamonds, interspersed among graphite triangles and diamonds executed in short parallel graphite strokes

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.Pink, orange and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-444.
